---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]

-->
- [x] depends on: #20220

</details>

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13005638865/job/36271920723)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
@hrmacbeth, is there a clever way to use `gcongr` or `rel` here?
Nice, thanks!

nit: I'd perhaps use `obtain` on all three liens for consistency.

(edit: or even just `let` in term mode, so that you can drop the `exact`
Another option is to have a lemma that turns a `(nhds 0).HasBasis p s` into `(nhds 0).HasBasis p (fun i => s i + s i)`, then use `HasBasis.isLittleOTVS_iff` for `(nhds_basis_balanced K E).newLemma`.

As far as I can tell your argument here only works in one direction; maybe the other direction is also trivially true using a lemma I haven't found:
```lean
theorem Filter.HasBasis.add_self {Î¹ : Sort*} [TopologicalAddGroup E] [ContinuousSMul ð•œ E]
    {p : Î¹ â†’ Prop} {s : Î¹ â†’ Set E}
    (h : (ð“ 0).HasBasis p s) :
    (ð“ 0).HasBasis p fun i => s i + s i := by
  constructor
  intro U
  constructor
  Â· intro hU
    rcases exists_open_nhds_zero_add_subset hU with âŸ¨Uâ‚, hUâ‚o, hUâ‚, hUâ‚U'âŸ©
    obtain âŸ¨i, hi, hsâŸ© := h.mem_iff.1 (hUâ‚o.mem_nhds hUâ‚)
    refine âŸ¨i, hi, add_subset_add hs hs |>.trans hUâ‚U'âŸ©
  Â· rintro âŸ¨i, hi, hsâŸ©
    rw [h.mem_iff]
    refine âŸ¨i, hi, subset_add_left _ ?_ |>.trans hsâŸ©
    sorry
```
Nevermind, it's trivial. I'll push what I have and let you golf it.

Is the converse statement,
```lean
theorem Frequently.smallSets_of_forall_mem_basis {p : Î¹ â†’ Prop} {s : Î¹ â†’ Set Î±} {P : Set Î± â†’ Prop}
    (hâ‚ : âˆ€ i, p i â†’ P (s i)) (hâ‚‚ : HasBasis l p s) : âˆƒá¶  t in l.smallSets, P t :=
  hâ‚‚.smallSets.frequently_iff.mpr fun _ hi => âŸ¨_, Subset.rfl, hâ‚ _ hiâŸ©
```
and below
```lean
theorem Frequently.smallSets_of_forall_mem {p : Set Î± â†’ Prop}
    (h : âˆ€ s âˆˆ l, p s) : âˆƒá¶  t in l.smallSets, p t :=
  .smallSets_of_forall_mem_basis h l.basis_sets
```
also worth having?
I don't know how to formulate the first one to make it useful. For the second one, the useful form is `âˆƒá¶  t in l.smallSets, t âˆˆ l`, and we already have it: `Filter.frequently_smallSets_mem`.

More details: I mostly use `(h : Frequently _ _)` to do something like `(h.and_eventually _).exists`, and `Eventually.exists_mem_basis_of_smallSets ` is enough for this use case. If you have other use cases in mind, then we can add `Frequently.smallSets_of_forall_mem_basis`.

My thinking was less that these lemmas are obviously useful, and more that they are obviously analogous to the lemmas which _are_ useful, and having them in mathlib saves the reader from wondering what they would look like.

For the first lemma, it's OK to add it, though I don't expect it to be used anytime soon. For the second lemma, I would prefer to have a comment explaining that `Filter.frequently_smallSets_mem` is the useful `Frequently` counterpart.

I've added one and a comment in place of the other.

Should we `maintainer merge` this?
